bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition brought about by wind. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 1: 風病 … 血氣俱虛，風邪併入 , “ Wind disease …when both blood and qi are depleted, wind evil enters”. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 mentions many kinds of wind disease such as feng bing ma mu 風病麻木 , wind disease with [numbness like] hemp and logs, feng bing luan ji 風病攣急 , wind disease with tension, and feng bing tan huan 風病癱瘓 , wind disease with paralysis. Feng chi 風齒 , wind teeth [1]

Alternative Names chi feng 齒風 , tooth wind; kou chi feng 口齒風 , mouth and tooth wind. Pathological Condition identical with feng ya 風牙 , wind teeth. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 29: 風齒候，頭面有 風，陽明之脈虛，風乘虛隨脈流入於齒者，則令齒有風 , “Signs of wind teeth : if head and wind have wind, and if the yin brilliance vessels are depleted, wind avails itself of this depletion and follows the vessels to flow through that person to his teeth. This causes the teeth to have wind”.
